title: Senior user researcher
description:
Better digital services can change the face of public services – and they start with you. Join us as a Senior User Researcher and you’ll contribute to projects that will affect every person in the UK at some point in their life.

You will hit the ground running, collaborating in an agile multi-disciplinary team environment alongside designers, developers and numerous stakeholders. You will need to be confident in explaining user needs to colleagues, and acting as a persuasive advocate for those needs both within the team and the department at large.

With a proven record in Digital Research, you’ll be used to working on large-scale digital projects. You will be experienced in using a variety of user research methodologies to reveal actionable insights and build a rich picture of customers and other user groups. You will have strong analytical and problem solving skills, and the ability to quickly develop recommendations based on quantitative and qualitative evidence.

If you’re ambitious, experienced and good with people, you could be joining us at one of our new digital hubs. Here, you’ll work to transform public services, putting user needs at the heart of your work. With a Department as large and complex as ours, the projects will be interesting, numerous and incredibly varied.

If you’d like to learn more about the team and the important work we do watch the video below or read the blog articles attached.
